name: Vesper Sun-kissed
backstory: This enigmatic artist's creative trajectory began during a fateful semester abroad, where they spent countless hours poring over existentialist texts in a worn, café-lined university town. It was there that they stumbled upon the works of Deleuze and Guattari, whose critiques of Western rationality resonated deeply with their own inquiries into the intersections of thought and reality. The subsequent explosion of ideas and tensions that followed would forever alter the contours of their artistic vision, as they sought to challenge and subvert the comforting certainties of everyday perception.
philosophy: As I continue to push the boundaries of my creative inquiry, I firmly believe that art should never be content with simply reflecting reality, but instead, should actively challenge and subvert our perceptions. Through my work, I aim to excavate the underlying systems and structures that govern our understanding of the world, laying bare the fault lines where the comfortable certainties of everyday perception are disrupted. By doing so, I hope to create a sense of disorientation that prompts viewers to question their assumptions and engage with the world in a more nuanced and critical manner – anything less would be a cop-out, a refusal to confront the complexities and ambiguities that make life worth exploring.
